definition: the two provinces of Guangdong and Guangxi (traditional)
two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)
surname Guang
"house on a cliff" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 53), occurring in 店, 序, 底 etc
wide/numerous/to spread
Governor of Guangdong and Guangxi

sentences.english: People with anaplasmosis usually live in Henan, Guangdong and Guangxi provinces.
sentences.chinese: 患病人群主要分布在河南及两广地区。

sentences.english: In 1936, Liangguang geological investigation institute dispatched its staff to investigate.
sentences.chinese: 1936年两广地质调查所派员调查。

sentences.english: Go in and see the menu is south by comparing menu.
sentences.chinese: 进去看菜单都是南亚两广菜色。

sentences.english: The Han Dynasty administered Guangdong, Guangxi, and northern Vietnam as Jiao Province.
sentences.chinese: 东汉在此设立交州，管辖两广及越南北部地区。

definition: Hubei and Hunan provinces (a Ming dynasty province)
Fujian and Guangdong
abbr. for Jiangsu 江蘇|江苏[Jiang1 su1] and Zhejiang 浙江[Zhe4 jiang1]
Guangxi Zhuang Autonomous Region 廣西壯族自治區|广西壮族自治区 in South Central China, on the border with Vietnam, abbr. 桂, capital Nanning 南寧|南宁/until 1959, Guangxi province
Shaanxi and Gansu provinces
south of the five ranges/old term for south China, esp. Guangdong and Guangxi
Hubei 湖北 and Hunan 湖南 provinces
Southeast Asia/South seas
Jiangxi province (Kiangsi) in southeast China, abbr. 赣, capital Nanchang 南昌
Wuzhou prefecture level city in Guangxi
Qinzhou prefecture level city in Guangxi
Ming and Qing dynasty province directly administered by Beijing, including Beijing, Tianjin, most of Hebei and Henan and part of Shandong
Yunnan province in southwest China, bordering on Vietnam, Laos and Myanmar, abbr. 滇[dian1] or 雲|云, capital Kunming 昆明
Guangdong province (Kwangtung) in south China, short name 粵|粤[Yue4], capital Guangzhou 廣州|广州
Qiongzhou, historic name for Hainan Island 海南島|海南岛[Hai3 nan2 Dao3]
